docs.snippet: MONTREAL, Sept. 18 -- As the Council of the United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration voted today to consider an expansion of its operations by extending aid to Italy, Director General Herbert H. Lehman warned that relief might have to...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTREAL, Sept. 18 -- As the Council of the United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration voted today to consider an expansion of its operations by extending aid to Italy, Director General Herbert H. Lehman warned that relief might have to be contracted because of delay by member Governments in contributing to the fund.
docs.abstract: Best wishes conveyed to UNRRA Montreal conf by Prime Min King

headline.main: RELIEF FOR ITALY ON UNRRA AGENDA; Council, Hearing Lehman's First Report, Votes to Consider Expansion Despite Fund Lag ONLY $1,200,000,000 GIVEN Many Participating Nations Pay Nothing -- Aid to Invaded States Offers Problems

byline.original: By RUSSELL PORTERSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Cabildo, most rabid of the pro-Nazi newspapers that have sprung up in Buenos Aires in recent years, denounces Secretary of State Hull as being responsible for a drop in quotations of Argentine state securities on the Buenos Aires Exchange. The charge...
docs.lead_paragraph: Cabildo, most rabid of the pro-Nazi newspapers that have sprung up in Buenos Aires in recent years, denounces Secretary of State Hull as being responsible for a drop in quotations of Argentine state securities on the Buenos Aires Exchange. The charge is not important.

docs.snippet: A CABLEGRAM received from Moscow by J.  H. Stolow says the U.S.S.R. is issuing two stamps to mark the seventy-fifth anniversary of the birth of Sergey Chaplygin (1869-1942), aeronautical scientist. Chaplygin dedicated his life to mechanics,...
docs.lead_paragraph: A CABLEGRAM received from Moscow by J. H. Stolow says the U.S.S.R. is issuing two stamps to mark the seventy-fifth anniversary of the birth of Sergey Chaplygin (1869-1942), aeronautical scientist. Chaplygin dedicated his life to mechanics, hydro-aeronautics and mathematics and belonged to the Academy of Sciences.

docs.snippet: ADVICES wirelessed from Stockholm to THE NEW YORK TIMES tell how Paul Joseph Goebbels, the Nazi Minister of Propaganda, has begun using what purport to be postage stamps as convincing "evidence" that what he has steadfastly maintained is really true...
docs.lead_paragraph: ADVICES wirelessed from Stockholm to THE NEW YORK TIMES tell how Paul Joseph Goebbels, the Nazi Minister of Propaganda, has begun using what purport to be postage stamps as convincing "evidence" that what he has steadfastly maintained is really true -- first, that Europe is being "sold out" by the United States to Stalin and, second, that Stalin and President Roosevelt are dividing the British Empire behind Churchill's back.
docs.abstract: Min Goebbels reptd issuing counterfeit United Nations postage stamps in propaganda attempt to discredit Allied intentions

docs.snippet: Describing himself as a leader of an extensive underground movement in Argentina, Felix Cernuschi, Professor of Theoretical Physics at the University of Tucuman in that country, declared in an interview yesterday in the office of The Nation, 20 Vesey...
docs.lead_paragraph: Describing himself as a leader of an extensive underground movement in Argentina, Felix Cernuschi, Professor of Theoretical Physics at the University of Tucuman in that country, declared in an interview yesterday in the office of The Nation, 20 Vesey Street, that he also represented a group about to form in Montevideo, Uruguay, a "liberation junta" that hoped to be recognized "by all democratic countries as our provisional government in exile."
docs.abstract: In US as visiting fellow at Princeton Univ; describes self as underground movement leader

headline.main: ARGENTINE HERE SAYS HE AIDS UNDERGROUND

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 15 -- Only a few hours before the funeral of former President Ramon S. Castillo yesterday, a book was put on sale -- "La Politica Argentina y el Futuro de America" (Argentine Policy and the Future of America) -- by his Foreign...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 15 -- Only a few hours before the funeral of former President Ramon S. Castillo yesterday, a book was put on sale -- "La Politica Argentina y el Futuro de America" (Argentine Policy and the Future of America) -- by his Foreign Minister, Dr. Enrique Ruiz Guinazu.
docs.abstract: Dr Ruiz Guinazu adds special appendix to book to answer Welles charges against him

headline.main: ARGENTINE SAYS U.S. ACTED ARBITRARILY; Ruiz Guinazu, Foreign Minister in Castillo Cabinet, Defends Post-Pearl Harbor Policy

docs.snippet: An effort by a group of Argentine nationalists in the city of Tucuman to take reprisals against a group of fourteen attorneys, who had protested the dissolution of their bar association by President Edelmiro Farrell's Government, was successfully...
docs.lead_paragraph: An effort by a group of Argentine nationalists in the city of Tucuman to take reprisals against a group of fourteen attorneys, who had protested the dissolution of their bar association by President Edelmiro Farrell's Government, was successfully challenged last month by persons who were not parties to the original protest, it was learned yesterday.
docs.abstract: Argentine nationalists reprisals against 14 members who protested dissolution revealed

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20 -- A market for $5,780,000,000 worth of new and used machinery, and other equipment from this country, will be found in the Latin-American republics in the ten years immediately following the war, according to estimates drawn up...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 20 -- A market for $5,780,000,000 worth of new and used machinery, and other equipment from this country, will be found in the Latin-American republics in the ten years immediately following the war, according to estimates drawn up by the Office of Coordinator of Inter-American Affairs.
docs.abstract: Estimates Latin-Amer market for US goods in 10 post-war yrs; outlines needs

headline.main: HUGE MARKET SEEN IN LATIN AMERICA; $5,780,000,000 in Demand Set for Machinery 10 Years After War by Coordinator HUGE MARKET SEEN IN LATIN AERICA
